column4: Hey, anybody know how to put breezy sources.list back to default?  I forgot to back it up...
I was trying to upgrade... I'm in the process.  Thats how I screwed over my sources.list
Tried that, it wont do anything
Update-manager just says there is nothing to update
er, actually now it just errors

It has a lot of Couldn't stat source package list http://archive.ubuntu.com breezy/universe Packages (/var/lib/apt/lists/archive.ubuntu.com_ubuntu_dists_breezy_universe_binary-i386_Packages) - stat (2 No such file or directory) errors
Failed to fetch http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/g/gzip/gzip_1.3.5-11ubuntu2.1_i386.deb
Could not connect to localhost:80 (127.0.0.1). - connect (111 Connection refused)
How can I update breezy without update-manager or a working sources.list?
So... what do I do if I screw over my sources.list?  Its trying to download from localhost...
just edit it?
what build are you using?
I am using Breezy
did you look for a sources.list to start fresh from, entirely replacing the old one?
send me your sources.list?
do you have gnome or kde?
do you know which you have?
type this in terminal: sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list.   copy and paste that into the site nubby sent you
dont use sudo unless it doesnt open
no clue man, sorry
good luck
